intro: Olax zenkeri, commonly known as the African olive, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries that contain the seeds. Olax zenkeri is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savannas and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
